What is Mental Health?

Learn More

What can we learn about Mental Health?

Mental health is just as important as physical health. It’s about how we think, feel, and act every day. Learning to understand and take care of our emotions helps us feel better, be kind to ourselves, and grow stronger in handling life’s challenges.

Talk About Your Feelings

It’s okay to feel sad, mad, or happy – everyone has different emotions! If something is bothering you, talk to a grown-up or a friend. Sharing how you feel helps you feel better and understand your emotions more clearly.

Take Deep Breaths

When you feel upset or stressed, try taking deep breaths. Breathe in slowly through your nose, hold it for a moment, then breathe out slowly. It helps calm your body and mind, making it easier to think clearly and feel better..

Take Time for Play

Playing isn’t just fun—it’s also good for your brain! Whether you’re drawing, running, or playing with toys, spending time doing things you enjoy can help you relax and feel happy.

Get Enough Sleep

Sleep is like a reset button for your body and mind. Make sure to get plenty of sleep each night so you feel rested and ready to face the day. A good night’s sleep helps you stay happy, healthy, and focused.

Feeling Anxious or Worried

It’s normal to feel nervous sometimes, like before a big test or presentation. But if you’re feeling worried all the time, it might be anxiety. Talking to a trusted adult can help you feel less worried and find ways to relax.

Feeling Sad for a Long Time

Sometimes everyone feels a little sad, but if you feel sad for many days or weeks, it could be depression. If you’re feeling this way, telling a parent, teacher, or counselor can help you get support and feel better.

Getting Angry Easily

If you find yourself getting upset or angry very quickly, you might be dealing with anger issues. Taking deep breaths, counting to ten, or asking for a break can help you calm down when you feel angry.

Having Trouble Paying Attention

It can be tough to focus at school or at home sometimes. If you find it hard to stay focused for a long time or if it’s hard to sit still, it might be attention issues. Talking with a teacher or counselor can help you learn ways to stay focused and do your best.
